Write a summary about 'astronomy'. Limit the output to 50 words. Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects, space, and the physical universe. It uses mathematics, physics, and chemistry to explain the origin and evolution of objects and events. Astronomy includes observing, measuring, and analyzing the properties of stars, galaxies, and other celestial bodies. It also explores the properties of interstellar matter and the effects of radiation in space. The study of astronomy helps us understand the universe's structure, composition, and dynamics.

Astronomy is an ancient field, with roots tracing back to the Babylonians and Greeks. It has evolved significantly over time, driven by technological advancements. Today, astronomers use powerful telescopes and sophisticated instruments to collect and analyze data from distant objects. They also employ advanced computer models to simulate cosmic events and processes. Astronomy has contributed to numerous scientific breakthroughs, including the discovery of exoplanets and the confirmation of the Big Bang theory. It continues to shape our understanding of the cosmos and our place within it.
